member.name: M:Waher.Script.Graphs3D.Canvas3D.#ctor
member.summary:
3D drawing area.
By default, the camera is looking along the z-axis, with no projection, and no scaling. The center of the canvas is located at origo.

member.name: M:Waher.Script.Graphs3D.Canvas3D.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,SkiaSharp.SKColor)
member.summary:
3D drawing area.
By default, the camera is looking along the z-axis, with no projection, and no scaling. The center of the canvas is located at origo.
member.param: Number of subpixels for each generated pixel. Oversampling provides a means to achieve anti-aliasing in the rendered result.

member.name: M:Waher.Script.Graphs3D.Canvas3D.GetPixels
member.summary: Creates a bitmap from the pixels in the canvas.

member.name: M:Waher.Script.Graphs3D.Canvas3D.CreatePixels(Waher.Script.Graphs.GraphSettings,System.Object[]@)
member.summary: Creates a bitmap of the graph.
member.param: State objects that contain graph-specific information about its inner states. These can be used in calls back to the graph object to make actions on the generated graph.

member.summary: Gets script corresponding to a point in a generated bitmap representation of the graph.

member.name: M:Waher.Script.Graphs3D.Canvas3D.Polygon(System.Numerics.Vector4[],SkiaSharp.SKColor,System.Boolean)
member.param: If the polygon is two-sided. If true, is used on both sides. If false, is only used on the front side. Which side is the front side, is determined from the Normal vector and viewing position. The Normal vector is determined from the order of the nodes defining the polygon.
